Identification.LongTitle: CCFTA Rules of Origin for Casual Goods Regulations

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to subsection 13(2)a of the Customs Tariffb, hereby makes the annexed CCFTA Rules of Origin for Casual Goods Regulations.

Section.Text: In these Regulations, casual goods means goods other than goods imported for sale or for an industrial, occupational, commercial or institutional or other like use.
Casual goods that are acquired in Chile are deemed to originate in Chile and are entitled to the benefit of the Chile Tariff if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the marking of the goods is in accordance with the marking laws of Chile and indicates that the goods are the product of Chile or Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the goods do not bear a mark and there is no evidence to indicate that the goods are not the product of Chile or Canada.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which section 9 of the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act, chapter 14 of the Statutes of Canada, 1997, comes into force.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Regulations in force July 5, 1997, see SI/97-86.]
